text.div:
NameCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Encounter ResourceAn interaction during which services are provided to the patient
identifier 0..*IdentifierIdentifier(s) by which this encounter is known
status 1..1codeplanned | in progress | onleave | finished | cancelled
EncounterState (Required)
class 1..1codeinpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +
EncounterClass (Required)
type 0..*CodeableConceptSpecific type of encounter
EncounterType (Example)
subject 0..1PatientThe patient present at the encounter
participant 0..*ElementList of participants involved in the encounter
type 0..*CodeableConceptRole of participant in encounter
ParticipantType (Incomplete)
individual 0..1Practitioner | RelatedPersonPersons involved in the encounter other than the patient
fulfills 0..1AppointmentThe appointment that scheduled this encounter
period 0..1PeriodThe start and end time of the encounter
length 0..1DurationQuantity of time the encounter lasted
reason 0..1CodeableConceptReason the encounter takes place (code)
EncounterReason (Example)
indication 0..1AnyReason the encounter takes place (resource)
priority 0..1CodeableConceptIndicates the urgency of the encounter
Priority (Example)
hospitalization 0..1ElementDetails about an admission to a clinic
preAdmissionIdentifier 0..1IdentifierPre-admission identifier
origin 0..1LocationThe location from which the patient came before admission
admitSource 0..1CodeableConceptFrom where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer)
AdmitSource (Incomplete)
period 0..1PeriodPeriod during which the patient was admitted
accomodation 0..*ElementWhere the patient stays during this encounter
bed 0..1LocationThe bed that is assigned to the patient
period 0..1PeriodPeriod during which the patient was assigned the bed
diet 0..1CodeableConceptDietary restrictions for the patient
PatientDiet (Incomplete)
specialCourtesy 0..*CodeableConceptSpecial courtesies (VIP, board member)
Courtesies (Incomplete)
specialArrangement 0..*CodeableConceptWheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc
Arrangements (Incomplete)
destination 0..1LocationLocation to which the patient is discharged
dischargeDisposition 0..1CodeableConceptCategory or kind of location after discharge
DischargeDisp (Incomplete)
dischargeDiagnosis 0..1AnyThe final diagnosis given a patient before release from the hospital after all testing, surgery, and workup are complete
reAdmission 0..1booleanIs this hospitalization a readmission?
location 0..*ElementList of locations the patient has been at
location 1..1LocationLocation the encounter takes place
period 0..1PeriodTime period during which the patient was present at the location
serviceProvider 0..1OrganizationDepartment or team providing care
partOf 0..1EncounterAnother Encounter this encounter is part of

structure.purpose: This is the definition for the Encounter resource

definition.short: An interaction during which services are provided to the patient
definition.formal: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

definition.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Language of the resource content
definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.short: Contained, inline Resources
definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known
definition.formal: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

definition.short: planned | in progress | onleave | finished | cancelled
definition.formal: planned | in progress | onleave | finished | cancelled.

mapping.map: No clear equivalent in V2.x; active/finished could be inferred from PV1-44, PV1-45, PV2-24; inactive could be inferred from PV2-16

definition.short: inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +
definition.formal: inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +.

definition.short: Specific type of encounter
definition.formal: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).
definition.comments: Since there are many ways to further classify encounters, this element is 0..*.

definition.short: The patient present at the encounter
definition.formal: The patient present at the encounter.
definition.comments: While the encounter is always about the patient, the patient may not actually be known in all contexts of use.

definition.short: List of participants involved in the encounter
definition.formal: The main practitioner responsible for providing the service.

definition.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Role of participant in encounter
definition.formal: Role of participant in encounter.

definition.short: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient
definition.formal: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient.

definition.short: The appointment that scheduled this encounter
definition.formal: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

mapping.map: SCH-1-placer appointment ID / SCH-2-filler appointment ID

definition.short: The start and end time of the encounter
definition.formal: The start and end time of the encounter.
definition.comments: If not (yet) known, the end of the Period may be omitted.

definition.short: Quantity of time the encounter lasted
definition.formal: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.
definition.comments: May differ from the time the Encounter.period lasted because of leave of absence.

mapping.map: (PV1-45 less PV1-44) iff ( (PV1-44 not empty) and (PV1-45 not empty) ); units in minutes

definition.short: Reason the encounter takes place (code)
definition.formal: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

binding.name: EncounterReason
binding.description: Reason why the encounter takes place

mapping.map:
EVN-4-event reason code / PV2-3-admit reason (note: PV2-3 is nominally constrained to inpatient admissions; V2.x makes no vocabulary suggestions for PV2-3; would not expect PV2 segment or PV2-3 to be in use in all implementations
)

definition.short: Reason the encounter takes place (resource)
definition.formal: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis.

definition.short: Indicates the urgency of the encounter
definition.formal: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

binding.name: Priority
binding.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter

definition.short: Details about an admission to a clinic
definition.formal: Details about an admission to a clinic.

definition.short: Pre-admission identifier
definition.formal: Pre-admission identifier.

definition.short: The location from which the patient came before admission
definition.formal: The location from which the patient came before admission.

definition.short: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer)
definition.formal: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer).

binding.name: AdmitSource
binding.description: From where the patient was admitted

definition.short: Period during which the patient was admitted
definition.formal: Period during which the patient was admitted.
definition.comments: May differ from start + length, since length excludes leaves of absence.

mapping.map: PV2-11-actual length of inpatient stay / PV1-44-admit date/time / PV1-45-discharge date/time

definition.short: Where the patient stays during this encounter
definition.formal: Where the patient stays during this encounter.

definition.short: The bed that is assigned to the patient
definition.formal: The bed that is assigned to the patient.

definition.short: Period during which the patient was assigned the bed
definition.formal: Period during which the patient was assigned the bed.

definition.short: Dietary restrictions for the patient
definition.formal: Dietary restrictions for the patient.

binding.name: PatientDiet
binding.description: Medical, cultural or ethical food preferences to help with catering requirements

definition.short: Special courtesies (VIP, board member)
definition.formal: Special courtesies (VIP, board member).

definition.short: Wheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc
definition.formal: Wheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc.

mapping.map: PV1-15-ambulatory status / OBR-30-transportation mode / OBR-43-planned patient transport comment

definition.short: Location to which the patient is discharged
definition.formal: Location to which the patient is discharged.

definition.short: Category or kind of location after discharge
definition.formal: Category or kind of location after discharge.

definition.short: The final diagnosis given a patient before release from the hospital after all testing, surgery, and workup are complete
definition.formal: The final diagnosis given a patient before release from the hospital after all testing, surgery, and workup are complete.

definition.formal: Whether this hospitalization is a readmission.

definition.short: Location the encounter takes place
definition.formal: The location where the encounter takes place.

mapping.map: PV1-3-assigned patient location / PV1-6-prior patient location / PV1-11-temporary location / PV1-42-pending location / PV1-43-prior temporary location

definition.short: Time period during which the patient was present at the location
definition.formal: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

definition.short: Department or team providing care
definition.formal: Department or team providing care.

mapping.map: PV1-10-hospital service / PL.6 Person Location Type & PL.1 Point of Care (note: V2.x definition is "the treatment or type of surgery that the patient is scheduled to receive"; seems slightly out of alignment with the concept name 'hospital service'. Would not trust that implementations apply this semantic by default)

definition.short: Another Encounter this encounter is part of
definition.formal: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: The stated language of the resource

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: A date within the period the Encounter lasted

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known

searchParam.name: location-period
searchParam.documentation: Time period during which the patient was present at the location

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: planned | in progress | onleave | finished | cancelled

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: The patient present at the encounter
